== Oneiric Alpha 2 ISO Testing Report- Jul 07, 2011 ==
Technical overview for Oneiric Alpha 2 is available at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/OneiricOcelot/TechnicalOverview

=== Testing Overview ===
==== Ubuntu ====
* i386/amd64
** Image Coverage: 100%
** Test Cases Coverage: 92%
*** Untested:
**** Desktop : VMWare Easyinstall, CJK install,

* ARM:
** OMAP3 doesn't work
** OMAP4: Major issue (<nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/779410|#779410]]</nowiki>) package initramfs-tools 0.98.8ubuntu3 failed to install/upgrade: subprocess installed post-installation script returned error exit status 1

* amd64+mac untested: Images are oversized (can't burn a CD) and bug 702283 (usb-creator doesn't create EFI-bootable USB sticks) blocks the creation of usb sticks.

* Other Major issues:
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/781076	package doc-base 0.9.5ubuntu2 failed to install/upgrade: Byte order is not compatible at ../../lib/Storable.pm
**** Fixed, affects i386 upgrades
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/788710	gnome-settings-daemon crashed with SIGSEGV in exit()
**** User annoyance but has no impact on the live session other than the apport message.
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/791454	RAID1 Test Failed: Device need to be readded manually
**** Server team is working on it
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/805783 nautilus crashed with SIGSEGV in ffi_call()
**** Fixed 
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/806349 OEM Install fails with - KeyError: "The cache has no package named 'python2.6-minimal'" - without network connection.
**** Workaround: plug a network cable.

==== Derivatives ====
* Xubuntu has problems with lightdm (live session doesn't start, uses wrong settings, empty default session)
* Edubuntu has critical issues:
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/791611 LTSP live doesn't work with new Network Manager
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/806419	nbd-server doesn't work on Oneiric
** https://launchpad.net/bugs/806428	Missing detailed package selection step in Oneiric
*** Fixed
* Ubuntu Studio and Mythbuntu received very little
* Kubuntu will skip Alpha 2. The critical issue from Alpha 1 (https://launchpad.net/bugs/791446) has been fixed since then.
